intro: Nasmythia septangularis, commonly known as the seven-angled grass, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive seven-sided leaf bases, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Nasmythia septangularis is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
